titleStmt.title: Edward Humphry to James F. Robinson
CWG8994

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excellency James F Robinson Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner Edward Humphry states that he was Indicted and at the present term of the ^Hancock Co^ Hancock Circuit Court found Guilty of the offence of selling liquor to William Herron Jr a Minor under the age of 21 years son of William Herron-- that neither the father nor son could write but before the selling refered to in the Indictment the father of the minor directed an older brother of the Minor to write an order to your petitioner authorizing him to sell to the Minor any liquor he might wish to drink-- this writing was made and delivered to your and was produced in court but the Minor stated that he could neither write nor read writing and athoulg a writing to that effect has been delivered to petitioner, he could not say the one produced in court was the Identical same writing authorised by his father-- the father & Eder son who wrote the authorization had since became non residents of the state of Ky and their evidence could not be processed,-- The court therefore refused allow the paper to go to the Jury and ^he^ was consequently found guilty. He makes copy of the Indictment and Judgment part hereof -- He prays that the fine be remitted
Subscribed & sworn to before me by Edward Humphry this 12 August 1863 --

p.hi: Geo W Tully D C H C C.

body.p: The undersigned are the Jury who tried the case of the Commonwealth agt Edward Humphers-- and state the foregoing petition is a fair statement of the trial and and conviction They respectfully unite in the petition that said fine be remitted

Hancock Cir. Ct
$50. } liquor to a minor
Issd Aug 18. 1863
Fine remitted except Ten dollars & the costs
